verses.text: Help, LORD, for the godly are no more; the faithful have vanished from among men.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 12:1
rsbNotes.text: 12:1 the godly one is gone. Like Elijah in 1 Kin. 19:14, the psalmist feels alone in his devotion to the Lord.

verses.text: Everyone lies to his neighbor; their flattering lips speak with deception.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 12:2
rsbNotes.text: 12:2 Everyone utters lies. Lit. “they speak lies,” or “emptiness,” including outright falsehoods, but also insincere and irresponsible talk, which cheapens and corrodes all human communication.

verses.text: May the LORD cut off all flattering lips and every boastful tongue
that says, "We will triumph with our tongues; we own our lips -who is our master?"

rsbNotes.title: Ps 12:3
rsbNotes.text: 12:3 cut off. To be “cut off” usually means to be excluded from the community, but occasionally may mean death.

verses.text: "Because of the oppression of the weak and the groaning of the needy, I will now arise," says the LORD. "I will protect them from those who malign them."
And the words of the LORD are flawless, like silver refined in a furnace of clay, purified seven times.
O LORD, you will keep us safe and protect us from such people forever.
The wicked freely strut about when what is vile is honored among men.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 12:5
rsbNotes.text: 12:5 arise. See Ps. 3:7 note.
